greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: The sum of the divisors of 24*n - 1, divided by 24.
comment: Conjecture: only the integers k in {1, 3, 4, 6, 8, 12, 24} have the property that the sum of the divisors of (k*n-1)/k is always an integer. - _Robert G. Wilson v_, Dec 25 2016
The finite sequence mentioned in the above conjecture gives the sum of the divisors of the partition numbers of the first seven positive integers (cf. A139041). - _Omar E. Pol_, Dec 25 2016
link: Ivan Neretin, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: 24 * a(n) = sum of the divisors of A183010(n).
mathematica: a[ n_] := If[ n < 1, 0, DivisorSigma[ 1, 24 n - 1] / 24];
results.author: _Michael Somos_, Dec 25 2016
